trustfund:
TF035974-COTE D'IVOIRE - SECOND
            NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL SUPPORT SERVICES

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second National Agricultural Support
            Services Program Project supports sustainable agricultural
            growth through sustained increases in farm-level
            productivity. This project is the first three-year phase of
            a long-term, 11-year program. There are four components. The
            first strengthens ANADER's (National Rural Development
            Agency) institutional reform and invests in human and
            physical infrastructure through adaptive research,
            extension, and support for farmers' organizations. The
            second component supports the National Agricultural Research
            Center (CNRA); strengthens the Ministry of Scientific
            Research to ensure the integration of agricultural research
            in national strategic planning and coordination of
            interdisciplinary research programs; and finances
            investments in research infrastructure and programs,
            scientific networking, and other capacity-building
            activities such as training and study tours. The third
            component helps the Central Planning Directorate
            decentralize its activities; helps the Statistics
            Directorate produce reliable statistics and carry out a
            national agricultural census; helps the Central Livestock
            Directorate plan and coordinate animal genetic improvement
            programs; and strengthens the policy-making and coordination
            activities of the Central Cooperative Directorate. The last
            component helps disseminate information on market/price,
            agricultural, and environmental issues by radio and
            television programs, installs rural radios, and funds
            technical assistance.
